text: Just learnt about the Philip Gosse argument in Omphalos (1857) that the navels of Adam and Eve (as unanimously (?) agreed to exist by the history of art, and demonstrated by Gosse through theological aesthetics) provide a model of divine historical falsification, that can be generalized to deep geological time. ...

... If God can simulate the vestige of umbilical cords, then he can simulate anything. 
According to Stephen Greenblatt (in The Rise and Fall of Adam and Eve, 2017) this argument was not well received.
Will be calling the Matrix movies 'neo-Gossean' from now on.
... Also from Greenblatt, among the books Darwin took with him on The Beagle were both Paradise Lost and Lyell's Principles of Geology.
Both of those narratives are running simultaneously over at Ron Unz's place.
... Anglin is celebrating the death of a pro-Israeli hack, while Ron himself suggests Netanyahu had him whacked for being the only anti-Israel voice around the president. It's an amazing place.
... If the Israelis didn't kill him, he deserved to die for not upsetting Israel enough, or something.

... Peak Ron: 
"The authorities have announced that the alleged assassin has now been caught, and it’s very possible that the official story will turn out to be entirely correct.
Nonetheless, ..."
The Apache without horses versus the English without guns?
I try not to be dogmatic about this stuff. Is anything emerging out of it?
... Have to say, it totally gets way more schizo and degraded than this.
I don't think the Anglos have ever respected an enemy more than the Plains Indians. It's almost love. Maybe it is love.
“Ein Teil von jener Kraft, die stets das Böse will und stets das Gute schafft”
"You do not belong in this city ..." ...
'Abroad' is hopefully not the USA. Liberia would be okay.
